channel.title: [Java] 11 Beginner Tutorials
channel.description:
Okay I know that this forum is about game development, but as some people have said, they don't know Java. So these are 12 videos (11 tutorials) about some very basic things to get you started with Java (I do end up making a small game in tutorial 9 but you guys would have to change it for actual players to be involved. Watch it and you'll see what I mean). And after all you have to know these basic things to get started in game development in the first place!
[b]Videos:[/b]
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5HSc788nKos[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vU5qotkDcg4[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0ZYQOmxiOX4[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mohbfm2aTbg[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QJaogzJtpqM[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y85AL37Mk9Q[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ukkcWy4xM58[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1QxKpq_WWjM[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CFjmkIaPaJI[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=25ps5udmorU[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-MTmd1QrvQ[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jU_PRCQJ3jc[/youtube]
[b]Playlist:[/b]
Here is a playlist of all of the tutorials: [url=http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0C95D109C8BABE13]http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0C95D109C8BABE13[/url]
The names of the videos are very broad as I go over multiple things, but the title of the video is the main focus of that video even if I introduce new topics. I also realize that there are other ways to do some of the things I show such as in the User Input tutorial, however I haven't really seen a difference between the two of them(buffered reader and scanner). Also I do have another video recorded right now but YouTube randomly took away my ability to post videos longer than 15 minutes so I have to edit it into two parts.
So, I hope you learn from these tutorials and get started on you're way to game development soon!

item.title: [Java] 11 Beginner Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @demps2k9 demps2k9
item.description:
@demps2k9 wrote:

Rather nice job Sp11k3t3ht3rd.

item.title: [Java] 11 Beginner Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“sp11k3t3ht3rd, post:8, topic:411455”][quote author=Triton link=topic=512714.msg3729356#msg3729356 date=1314507184]
Programming in Notead? :o

At the very least use a lightweight programming text editor: http://www.flos-freeware.ch/notepad2.html

I highly recommend using the installer and replacing it as the default editor in Windows.
[/quote]

Everyone always bothers me about that. It’s just, when you’re learning or doing simple stuff like this, I don’t feel like you need syntax highlighting and all that. I do use Netbeans just not for most of my videos.[/quote]

Even if the syntax highlighting doesn’t help you, it does help the people watching the video to pick up on the code quicker.

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] 11 Beginner Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

[quote=“Triton, post:7, topic:411455”]Programming in Notead? :o

At the very least use a lightweight programming text editor: http://www.flos-freeware.ch/notepad2.html

I highly recommend using the installer and replacing it as the default editor in Windows.[/quote]

Everyone always bothers me about that. It’s just, when you’re learning or doing simple stuff like this, I don’t feel like you need syntax highlighting and all that. I do use Netbeans just not for most of my videos.

item.title: [Java] 11 Beginner Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @ripzone Triton
item.description:
@ripzone wrote:

Programming in Notead? :o

At the very least use a lightweight programming text editor: http://www.flos-freeware.ch/notepad2.html

I highly recommend using the installer and replacing it as the default editor in Windows.
